intro: Tanacetum shiwogiku, commonly known as Japanese tansy, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-white composite flowers and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and thrives in well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has a long history of use in traditional Japanese gardens. The foliage and flowers emit a subtle, aromatic scent, contributing to its appeal in horticultural settings.
